document.heading: Hacker’s License Record Keeping Amendment Act of 1986

history.narrative: Law 6-165, the “Hacker’s License Record Keeping Amendment Act of 1986,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-334, which was referred to the Committee on Public Works. The Bill was adopted on the first and second readings on July 8, 1986 and September 23, 1986, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 9, 1986, it was assigned Act No. 6-211 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
